Safety Information from Dr. Cassell, Superintendent

h2.span: All Waynesboro Public Schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.

p.span: Waynesboro Public Schools is committed to a quality education that includes a strong academic program designed to meet student needs; comprehensive programs which prepare and encourage students to be productive citizens; quality learning environments and school facilities; a diverse, highly trained staff committed to working effectively with youth; and strong partnerships with parents and the community.

h3.style: box-sizing: border-box; clear: both; font-family: arvoregular, serif; line-height: 1.3; font-size: 25px; margin: 18px 0px; text-shadow: white 0px 2px; color: rgb(110, 110, 110); background-color: rgb(247, 246, 244); text-align: center;

p.span:
We understand each day brings its own set of challenges.
Our utmost concern is for the educational needs,
safety and well-being of our students,
parents and community.
We will continue to provide information to prepare and educate our community during this time.

strong.br:
Our School Division is working diligently to provide
Internet Access to our students during the school closure.
Please complete:

span.span: Our Meal Service is available at all four elementary schools on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 9:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. Meals are served to children ages 18 and under.

div.div: The Waynesboro School Board will meet on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 at Waynesboro High School, 1200 West Main Street at 7:00 p.m.
div.a: Read More about School Board Meeting: April 14, 2020

a.title: Staunton News Leader: Meals for Students

div.a: Staunton News Leader: Meals for Students
div.div: Waynesboro and Augusta County began distributing food to their students Tuesday, March 17, 2020. Staunton will begin providing meals Wednesday, March 18, 2020.
div.a: Read More about Staunton News Leader: Meals for Students

div.div: There is currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus. These are everyday habits that can help prevent the spread of viruses.

h3.style: font-size: 26px; border-bottom: 3px solid rgb(0, 132, 204); margin: 0px 0px 15px; font-family: lusitanaregular; font-weight: normal; padding-bottom: 5px;

div.p: Waynesboro Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. Waynesboro Public Schools also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
